    • Method Detail

      • buildPlace

        public void buildPlace​(java.lang.String name)
        Builds a place in the map. Meaning adding a node to the map that represents the playing field. Connections between Places can be made via buildStreet().
        Parameters:
        name - The user-displayable name of the Place.

      • buildStreet

        public void buildStreet​(Place start,
                        Place end,
                        Vehicle ticketNeeded)
        Builds a street between to places in the map. Meaning adding a connection between two given nodes on the map that represents the playing field. Nodes can be added via buildPlace().
        Parameters:
        start - The starting point of the street (starting and ending points do not matter and are just internally managed this way)
        end - The ending point of the street (starting and ending points do not matter and are just internally managed this way)
        ticketNeeded - The Ticket needed to travel this street

      • doMove

        public boolean doMove​(Player toMove,
                      Place destination,
                      Ticket toUse)
        Does a basic move, meaning moving a player to an adjacent place and removing the given ticket corresponding to the street connecting the start and destination place. A ticket has to be given because it is important not to just put any ticket with the right vehicle away, but one with the ability (chosen by the player) too, so the player can strategically collect abilities. If this method returns false, the GameState-data has not been changed.
        Parameters:
        toMove - The player who is making his move
        destination - The place to go to
        toUse - The ticket to be used for the journey
        Returns:
        True, if the move was done successfully (player moved, ticket removed). False, if the ticket to use is not in the inventory, if the destination is not directly connected to the current place of the player via a street or if the street cannot be travelled with the given ticket

      • activateAbility

        public boolean activateAbility​(Player player,
                               java.util.Vector<Ticket> ticketsUsed,
                               Ability toActivate)
        Reliefs players from the tickets necessary to activate the given ability. The specific ability's effects will have to be done after calling this method. via two calls of doTurn() for Mr. X or the doFreeTurn() for the detective(s).
        Parameters:
        player - The player activating his ability. Will only be used to differentiate between Mr. X and detectives.
        ticketsUsed - A vector containing the tickets to be used for the "extra turn"-ability
        toActivate - The
        Returns:
        True, if the tickets were successfully removed from the inventory. False, if the wrong number of tickets were given via the Vector, if one of the tickets in the given Vector is not in the inventory, if one of the tickets is not for the "extra turn"-ability.
        See Also:
        doFreeTurn(Player, Place)

      • doFreeTurn

        public void doFreeTurn​(Player player,
                       Place destination)
        Moves the player to an adjacent Place without the need to use a Ticket.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to be moved for free.
        destination - The destination place to let the player go to.

      • giveTicket

        public void giveTicket​(Player player,
                       Ticket toGive)
        Gives a free ticket to a given player
        Parameters:
        player - The Player to receive the ticket. This is only for differentiating between Mr. X and detectives.
        toGive - The Ticket to give to the specified Player.

      • takeTicket

        public boolean takeTicket​(Player player,
                          Ticket toTake)
        Removes a ticket from a given player
        Parameters:
        player - The Player to take the ticket from. This is only for differentiating between Mr. X and detectives.
        toTake - The Ticket to take from the specified Player.
        Returns:
        True, if a Ticket was successfully removed from an inventory. False, if the Ticket was not present in the Inventory to begin with.

      • getPlayerByPort

        public Player getPlayerByPort​(int port)
        Returns the player corresponding to the given port.
        Parameters:
        port - The port of the player to return (0: Mr. X; 1+: Detectives).
        Returns:
        The Player-Object with the given port.
